body.name: The Unbending Duke’s Betrothed: A Historical Regency Romance Novel
body.description: “Pretend you are madly in love with me. It is our only option…”Duke Griffin knows that the Earl of Lyford killed his father. And if he needs to court the man’s niece to prove it, so be it.Marina has until the end of the Season to find a suitor or her uncle will see to her fate. So when the Duke offers her a way out, she knows she cannot refuse.Their agreement is simple enough. Pretend to court and accomplish both their goals in one. But they cannot keep their eyes off each other, and that attraction proves fatal.For the killer is already hunting them down…*If you like powerful Dukes, loving Duchesses and a marvelous depiction of the majestic Regency and Victorian era, then The Unbending Duke’s Betrothed is the novel for you.An enchanting regency romance of 80,000 words (around 400 pages), written by Patricia Haverton and published by Cobalt Fairy.No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a sweet happily ever after.Pick up "The Unbending Duke’s Betrothed" today to discover Patricia's captivating story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finding Love Stomped Out The Evil !
reviews.reviewText: The Duke was on a Mission to seek answers on who Murdered his Father . He devised a Plan to Court the Earls daughter . Since he believed he was the person that murder his Father. Getting close to the family was the only way he could gather clues. Only in doing so , He Opened Pandoras Box ! So Much Evil was discovered ! There was also another Young Lady there. She was the daughter of the real Earl of Lyford . Now two cousins competing for the Duke ! More Drama ! One Courtship Down and another one started. More Plans and Discoveries . Fake Courtship and Real Feelings ? Can this be possible ? Amongst all this Mean and Evil can Love Blossom ?Marina Bosley was the daughter to the Earl of Lyford. She lived a good life to her Father suddenly died. Now living with her Uncle the new Earl of Lyford and her Cousin Nancy. Things were far from pleasant . They were down right Mean and Cruel !Griffin Northwood the Duke of Darrington believed that the new Earl of Lyford killed his Father. He needed to court his daughter to gather evidence to convict him.Griffin and Marina meet when he begins to court her cousin Nancy. Griffin had nothing in common with Nancy and did not even like her . He just needed Clues ! Marina on the other hand was everything that Nancy was not. Pretty, Smart, Conversational, and a Chemistry to Boot ! They decide to team up and have a fake courtship and gather more evidence to get on the Earl ! What could go wrong ? Well , Dealing with a Crazy , Cruel , Evil, Hateful Earl , Anything Can Happen !This Story is Filled with Excitement, Sorrow, Good Versus Evil ! Love Hidden amongst the Ugly Hate ! The whole time Wishing for Love To Prevail for all !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Marina and Griffin
reviews.reviewText: This is a murder mystery that begins with a courtship, but then twists to another. Ms Haverton’s brilliant talents prove themselves in her dramatic mysteries as it does in this story. A few villains, tangled plot, vindictive revenge tactics, and secrets to reveal, all surrounded by a budding romance as the couple focuses on investigating the murders. The plot is definitely engaging, great characters and well-crafted twists and turns. The author created believable characters with emotional upheavals that easily brought out my empathetic side. Marina’s living arrangements was incredibly sad, and I was anxious for her finding her HEA. I definitely would have liked to give this book a 5-star review but the editing issues played a role in my final rating. Editing issues included typos, indecision on using a lower or uppercase for “uncle”, and misspelling of the character, Josiah. I remain a huge Patricia Haverton fan, and highly recommend this book. No so much her editor. lol I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars His plan changes
reviews.reviewText: Griffin is a Duke and wants his father’s killer to pay. Marina has to find a suitor before the season ends or her uncle will find someone that she’s afraid of! The two come together as her uncle is who Griffin is after and was going to use Marina to get closer. Unfortunately they have eyes for each other and will make his plan more complicated! I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Danger Lurks but So Does Love
reviews.reviewText: Marina losing her father and her uncle comes in taking over. Her uncle is mean and overbearing and threatens her with finding a husband or she is out. She meets Duke Griffin when he asked permission to court Nancy, her cousin. One day Marina caught the duke going through papers in her uncle's study. Knowing he needed to explain himself he takes her in confidence and explains that he felt her uncle killed his father. This sparked an interest with Marina because she then wondered if he had anything to do with her father's death. They decide to make an alliance and he stated he wanted to court Marina not Nance, which caused all kinds of upheaval. Can the prove what they thinked happened without endangering themselves? ARC Review

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Falling in love while hunting a killer
reviews.reviewText: I call these "the fake it until you make it" tropes. Anytime two people who are attracted to each other pretend to be courting, engaged or married, invariably they end up falling in love. Although this time, it is a dangerous game when hunting for a killer, because if he killed what is to stop him from doing the same thing again? Falling in love while hunting for killer sets this to be an emotional story. The funny part of this story is that Griffin starts out courting the wrong girl.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great read
reviews.reviewText: Griffin was courting Marina's cousin to get close to her father to find proof he killed his father. Marina caught him looking for proof and he switched to courting her so she could help him. As the two looked for proof they grew close. As things started coming together Marina got in a fight with her uncle and in anger she exposed all. Griffin had to come to the rescue of all involved including the arrest of her uncle. After they were able to admit their love for each other.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars It took a very long time to get to the HEA
reviews.reviewText: This book was very depressing. Sorry. Not sorry. I bumped it up one star because the author is a good writer - very descriptive. Heartfelt. But this was waaaay too sad

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Clean and sweet
reviews.reviewText: You can read the book summary so I will forgo that in my review.This book was clean and sweet with no cliff hangers. I enjoyed that and will continue to support those kinds of books. However, the writing was very basic. Some of the characters were flat and needed a little more development. And yet, I kept reading. Some of the dialogue between the hero and heroine was stilted and unrealistically dramatic; and yet, I kept reading.What kept me reading? Well, I wanted to find out how they were going to catch the villain. That part of the plot was solid, but even there I wanted to see more red herrings or nuggets of “gotcha now” when they actually didn’t. The reader finally get’s a hint towards the end of the book but it would have been nice to see things throughout.Of course I love a good love story and an independent woman, but I think they fell in love a little too quickly. All in all, I would recommend this book if you wanted a clean romance novel with no twists and turns.

Griffin and Marina's starting point for a relationship is less than prosperous: revenge and self - preservation, necessities and threats are not the only obstacles in the way of their growing mutual attraction. By joining forces they manage to secure their own safety and find a reliable partner to spend the rest of their life with - a wonderful combination of suspense and romance.

I was disappointed by the story. The plot itself might have been good but was poorly executed. It reminded me of a farcical theater piece, definitely not of a suspenseful love story. The story felt contrived from the start, the plot and the behaviour of the characters unnatural and illogical. Their detective work seems amateurish, their actions are rather daft. There are better books by this author.Marina is determined to find a husband by the end of the season so that she can leave her vicious uncle.When she catches Griffin, her cousin's suitor, sneaking around the house, he tells her that he believes her uncle to be his father's murderer. She agrees to help him with his enquiries and enters into a fake relationship with him, knowing full well that she is putting herself in danger and that she incurs the wrath of her whole family But she also suspects that her uncle could also be responsible for her father's death...
